title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin (2025). inschooldata: Fetch Process Indiana School Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/almartin82/inschooldata.
code: @Manual{,   title = {inschooldata: Fetch and Process Indiana School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/almartin82/inschooldata}, }

title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started Fetch analyze Indiana public school enrollment data Indiana Department Education (IDOE).

what: What can you find with inschooldata?
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: 20 years enrollment data (2006-2025). 1.05 million students today. 290 corporations. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
what: 1. Indiana is stable while neighbors decline
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: Illinois Ohio lose students, Indiana held steady around 1.05 million decade. Hoosier State neither booming busting.
code: library(inschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
what: 2. Indianapolis Public Schools is shrinking fast
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: IPS lost 15,000 students since 2006, dropping 35,000 25,000. Charter schools suburban flight reshaping Indy education.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2006:2025)  enr %>%   filter(grepl("Indianapolis Public Schools", corporation_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          is_corporation, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
what: 3. Hamilton County is Indiana’s growth engine
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: Carmel, Fishers, Westfield, Noblesville suburbs booming. Hamilton County corporations added 20,000 students since 2010.
code: enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  hamilton <- c("Carmel Clay Schools", "Hamilton Southeastern Schools",               "Noblesville Schools", "Westfield-Washington Schools")  enr %>%   filter(corporation_name %in% hamilton, is_corporation,          grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(total = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: Hispanic students went 5% 13% enrollment since 2006. Northwest Indiana Indianapolis drive growth.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "hispanic") %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "K",          end_year %in% 2019:2025) %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
what: 6. One in four students qualifies for free lunch
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: 250,000 Indiana students receive free lunch. Economic disadvantage varies wildly geography. Gary, East Chicago, Indianapolis 80%+ rates. Carmel Zionsville 5%.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "free_lunch") %>%   select(n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
what: 7. Gary Community School Corporation has collapsed
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: Gary lost 20,000 students since 2006, dropping 22,000 5,000. one dramatic declines America.
code: enr %>%   filter(grepl("Gary Community School", corporation_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          is_corporation, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: Indiana’s virtual charter schools grown dramatically, especially COVID. Indiana Virtual School Indiana Connections Academy among largest.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(grepl("Virtual|Online|Connections|Digital", corporation_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(corporation_name, n_students) %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
what: 9. Evansville is bucking the urban decline
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: urban districts shrink, Evansville Vanderburgh School Corp remained stable around 22,000 students. Southwest Indiana different.
code: enr %>%   filter(grepl("Evansville Vanderburgh", corporation_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          is_corporation, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with inschooldata?
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: Indiana 320 corporations 2006. Today 300. Small rural districts continue merge.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2006, 2015, 2025)) %>%   filter(is_corporation, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(n_corporations = n())

title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
code: library(inschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # Fetch all 20 years of data enr_all <- fetch_enr_multi(2006:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # Corporation breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_corporation, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   select(corporation_name, n_students)  # Demographics by corporation enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_corporation, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   group_by(corporation_name, subgroup) %>%   summarize(n = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))

title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: Levels: State, corporation (~290), school (~1,900) Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Special populations: Special Education, ELL, Free Lunch, Reduced Lunch Grade levels: Pre-K Grade 12

title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: Indiana uses simple 4-digit ID system: - Corporation ID: 4 digits (e.g., 5385 Indianapolis Public Schools) - School ID: 4 digits within corporation Note: Indiana calls districts “corporations” (school corporations).

what: Part of the 50 State Schooldata Family
title: inschooldata - Indiana School Enrollment Data
text: package part family R packages providing school enrollment data 50 US states. package fetches data directly state’s Department Education. See also: njschooldata - original state schooldata package New Jersey. packages: github.com/almartin82

title: Clear the inschooldata cache — clear_cache
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clear all cached data clear_cache()  # Clear only 2024 data clear_cache(2024)  # Clear only tidy format data clear_cache(type = "tidy") } # }

Fetch Indiana enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Indiana Department Education's Data Center.

title: Fetch Indiana enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2006-2025. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download IDOE.

title: Fetch Indiana enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns corporation_id, school_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Indiana enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific corporation indianapolis_ps <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(corporation_id == "5385") } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: inschooldata: Fetch and Process Indiana School Data — inschooldata-package
title: inschooldata: Fetch and Process Indiana School Data — inschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Indiana Department Education (IDOE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data IDOE's Data Center transforming tidy format analysis.

title: inschooldata: Fetch and Process Indiana School Data — inschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations get_available_years Get available data years

title: inschooldata: Fetch and Process Indiana School Data — inschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: inschooldata: Fetch and Process Indiana School Data — inschooldata-package
text: Indiana uses simple ID system: Corporation IDs: 4 digits (e.g., 5385 = Indianapolis Public Schools) School IDs: 4 digits (unique within corporation)

title: inschooldata: Fetch and Process Indiana School Data — inschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Indiana Department Education's Data Center: Data Center: https://www..gov/doe//data-center--reports/ INview: https://inview.doe..gov/

title: inschooldata: Fetch and Process Indiana School Data — inschooldata-package
text: Years: 2006-2025 (20 years historical data) Aggregation levels: State, Corporation (District), School Demographics: Race/ethnicity, gender, special education, ELL, free/reduced lunch Grade levels: PK, K, 1-12
